login.title: User login
login.description:
Please enter a username and password. The login credentials are only used for the initial data query and are not stored.
Also set the interval for data queries outside and during active alarms.

api_key.title: Enter API key
api_key.description: If the login fails or a system user should be logged in, the user's API key can be entered here as an alternative.

multi_cluster.title: Select unit
multi_cluster.description: Multiple units were found for the entered user. Please select the desired unit. Additional units must be added separately.

reconfigure.title: Change configuration for DiveraControl
reconfigure.description: By changing the API key, a different user can be assigned to the unit. Additionally, both intervals can be reconfigured.

abort.new_data_only:
Configuration completed.

The following units were created: {new_data}
abort.existing_data_only:
Configuration completed.

The following units already exist and were not created: {existing_data}
abort.no_new_hubs_found: No new units were found, therefore no new hubs were created.
abort.missing_entry_id: Hub ID could not be determined.

common.usergroup_4: The logged-in user is a standard user. Access permissions depend on Divera permissions, so some data may not be available.
common.usergroup_5: The logged-in user is a monitor user. Access permissions depend on Divera permissions, so some data may not be available.
common.usergroup_8: The logged-in user is a user with admin rights and has access to all data.
common.usergroup_14:
The logged-in user is the default API user. Access is therefore not possible to:
- Alarm data
- News
- Appointments
- Dashboards
common.usergroup_19:
The logged-in user is a system user and will therefore not have access to:
- Alarm data
- News
- Appointments
common.usergroup_unknown: A user from an unknown user group {usergroup_id} was logged in. Depending on granted permissions, not all data may be available.
